The expert: s focus was on the statement that the vast majority of people who got insurance under President Obama's Affordable Care Act got it through Medicaid.
The expert reached out to Senator Rand P: s office for the source of his claim but did not receive a response.
The U: S. Health and Human Services Department issued a report in March 2016 that supported Senator Paul's claim to some extent. The report stated that Medicaid and CHIP added 14.5 million people by the end of 2015.
However: analysts pointed out that a fair number of those new people were eligible for coverage under old rules that predated the Affordable Care Act, such as children who were already eligible under Medicaid or CHIP.
